title.native: ヴァンパイア・イン・ザ・ガーデン

description:
One cold winter, humanity lost its battle with the vampires, and with it, most of where they called home. A small population of survivors created a wall of light in a small town to protect them and give them a place to live in peace. Our protagonist, Momo, lives a repressed life but still wishes to coexist with the enemy, the vampires. Fine, the vampire queen, once loved humans and disappeared from the battlefield. As war rages through the humans’ town, the two have a fateful encounter. Once upon a time, humans and vampires lived in harmony in a place called Paradise. This is the story of a young girl and a vampire on a journey to find Paradise.

(Source: Netflix)
synonyms: แวมไพร์ในสวน

node.description:
Nishio graduated from Nagoya Designer Academy and started his career at Anime Spot, a subcontracting studio, after being refused in interviews with several animation studios. He debuted as an in-betweener on [Osomatsu-kun](https://anilist.co/anime/9883/) and as a key animator on [Laughing Salesman](https://anilist.co/anime/3077/).

It's on [Yu Yu Hakusho](https://anilist.co/anime/392//) that Nishio came into his own as an animator, developing weighty and realistic movements influenced by [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/). Thanks to the ability demonstrated there, he was chosen to design the characters for [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

After working as character designer and chief animation director on [Jin-Roh](https://anilist.co/anime/570/) he permanently joined Production I.G. where he became known, together with [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/) and [Kazuchika Kise](https://anilist.co/staff/115781/), as "The Three Gods of I.G."

[Masashi Kishimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96879/) requested for Nishio to be the character designer of the Naruto anime.

In August 2020, he was promoted to company director of Production I.G alongside [Takayuki Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/103266/Takayuki-Gotou/), a co-founder of the studio.

Anime Director. He began his career at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he would eventually make his directorial debut with [Claymore](https://anilist.co/anime/1818/). He then notably worked as Assistant Director throughout the [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/) adaptation at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), and has since continued to serve as Assistant and Episode Director on various projects there.

Affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [Producer](https://anilist.co/staff/155543) or other [Director](https://anilist.co/staff/226420) with the same name._

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently he mainly works with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), but has previously worked for studios such as [Telecom](https://anilist.co/studio/94/), [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) and [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

Made his debut as a director with [Hal](https://anilist.co/anime/16528/) in 2013.

[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Profile](https://asahi-pro.co.jp/creator/yamada-kazuhiro)

Affiliated with Asahi Production.

_Note: Not to be confused with the other [composite artist](https://anilist.co/staff/252146/) by the same name._
__Kengo Takebana__ is a Japanese animator, who does in-between, key and 2nd key animation.

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Gakuin, he joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/). Currently he mainly works with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/), but has previously worked for studios such as [Telecom](https://anilist.co/studio/94/), [Shin-Ei](https://anilist.co/studio/247/) and [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

Made his debut as a director with [Hal](https://anilist.co/anime/16528/) in 2013.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ozaki_t) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ozaki32/) | [Tumblr](https://ozaki3.tumblr.com/)

Tomomi Ozaki is a freelance illustrator, designer and an infrequent animator. She has provided design works to various anime series.

She is married to fellow illustrator and designer, [toi8](https://anilist.co/staff/112641/Toi8).
